Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the percentage of on-time deliveries from suppliers.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of On-Time Deliveries from Suppliers / Total Number of Supplier Deliveries) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the cost of inbound transportation per unit of material.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Inbound Transportation Costs / Total Number of Units Transported

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the percentage of orders that meet the agreed-upon lead times.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Orders Delivered On Time by Supplier / Total Number of Orders) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the accuracy of supplier deliveries against order specifications.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Accurate Deliveries from Suppliers / Total Number of Deliveries) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.KPIS: Inventory turnover rate for inbound materials
Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures how often inventory is turned over for inbound materials.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Cost of Goods Sold for Inbound Materials / Average Inventory for Inbound Materials

Supply Chain+Logistics.KPIS: Percentage of inventory damaged in transit
Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the proportion of inventory damaged during transit.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Amount of Inventory Damaged in Transit / Total Amount of Inventory Shipped) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the total number of quality issues reported from suppliers.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Count of Quality Issues Reported with Suppliers

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures how quickly suppliers respond to urgent orders.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Urgent Orders Fulfilled by Supplier on Time / Total Number of Urgent Orders) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the percentage of on-time deliveries to customers.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of On-Time Deliveries to Customers / Total Number of Customer Deliveries) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the accuracy of order fulfillment against order specifications.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Accurate Orders Fulfilled / Total Number of Orders Fulfilled) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the cost of outbound transportation per unit of product.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Outbound Transportation Costs / Total Number of Units Shipped

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the percentage of deliveries that meet the agreed-upon lead times to customers.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Orders Delivered on Time / Total Number of Orders) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the proportion of orders returned by customers.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Orders Returned / Total Number of Orders) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures how satisfied customers are with the delivery process.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Average Rating of Customer Satisfaction with Delivery Process

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the accuracy of order picking.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Accurate Orders Picked / Total Number of Orders Picked) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the effectiveness of optimizing transportation modes.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Optimized Transportation Modes / Total Number of Transportation Modes Used) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the cost efficiency of the distribution network.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Total Distribution Network Costs / Total Sales Revenue) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures how efficiently the capacity of distribution centers is used.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Current Distribution Center Utilization / Total Available Capacity) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.KPIS: Order processing time at distribution centers
Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the average time taken to process orders at distribution centers.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Time to Process Orders / Total Number of Orders Processed

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the volume of goods processed at distribution centers over time.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Number of Orders Processed / Total Time for Processing Orders

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the accuracy of inventory records at distribution centers.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Accurate Inventory Counts / Total Number of Inventory Counts) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.KPIS: Distribution network responsiveness to demand changes
Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures how quickly the distribution network adapts to changes in demand.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Adjustments Made to Meet Demand Changes / Total Number of Demand Changes) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the geographical area covered by the distribution network.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Geographic Area Covered by the Distribution Network

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the reliability and resilience of the distribution network.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Successful Deliveries / Total Number of Delivery Attempts) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the average distance of delivery routes.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Distance Traveled for Deliveries / Total Number of Deliveries

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the number of deliveries made per unit distance traveled.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Total Number of Deliveries / Total Delivery Route Distance)

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the fuel consumed per delivery route.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Fuel Consumed / Total Distance Traveled on the Route

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the reduction in time vehicles spend idle.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Previous Idle Time - Current Idle Time) / Previous Idle Time * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the percentage of deliveries made on time for each route.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of On-Time Deliveries per Route / Total Number of Deliveries per Route) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the percentage of instances where delivery routes deviate from the planned route.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Deviations from Planned Route / Total Number of Routes) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the average time it takes to complete a delivery route.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Time for Deliveries on a Route / Total Number of Deliveries on the Route

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the maintenance cost for each route covered by a vehicle.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Vehicle Maintenance Costs / Total Number of Routes

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the percentage of time vehicles are in use.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Total Vehicle Hours Used / Total Vehicle Hours Available) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the maintenance cost per mile/kilometer driven by a vehicle.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Vehicle Maintenance Costs / Total Miles/Kilometers Traveled

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the average fuel efficiency of the fleet.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Fuel Consumed / Total Miles/Kilometers Traveled

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the total downtime of the fleet due to maintenance.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Downtime for Maintenance / Total Fleet Operating Time * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the accident rate within the fleet.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Accidents / Total Vehicle Miles/Kilometers) * 1,000,000

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the compliance of vehicles with emissions standards.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Compliant Vehicles / Total Number of Vehicles) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the compliance of drivers with safety regulations.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: (Number of Compliance Incidents / Total Number of Inspections) * 100

Supply Chain+Logistics.EXPLANATION: Measures the total cost of owning and operating a vehicle over its entire lifecycle.
Supply Chain+Logistics.FORMULA: Total Costs for Vehicle Acquisition, Maintenance, Fuel, and Depreciation / Number of Vehicles
